intro: Maihueniopsis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plants are typically perennial and thrive in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures. Maihueniopsis species are often found in rocky soils and are adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions. Their unique morphology and ecological niche make them an important part of the Andean flora.
